page.title: 08Taverham Hall Farm
page.content: {Taverham Hall farm}is part of {Easton Estates}which, with other farms, owns about 2500 acres of land in the{Wensum valley}and is owned by {Mr.Rampton.}Taverham Hall farm is managed for him by{Mr.Sallis.}It covers 240 acres of arable land, 100 acres of marsh grazing and 30 acres of woodland. Crops include linseed, peas, oilseed rape, sugar beet, barley, rye, wheat, dwarf beans, potatoes & maize. They let out land and sheds for fattening beef cattle from Wiltshire. Easton Estates employs only 6 workers in total of which only 1 works on Hall Farm. When the farm needs machinery, they borrow it from other farms on the estate. Grain crops are sold to{Seaman {of Swaffham,}rye to{'Ryvita'}and sugar beet to the{British Sugar Corporation processing plant at Cantley.
